PatientDetails.Name: Joanna Sprague
HospitalCourse: Admitted on 09/19/2024 with NSTEMI and cardiogenic shock.
Underwent percutaneous coronary intervention and supported with Impella.
Extubated but re-intubated due to respiratory failure.
Developed leukocytosis and fevers, concerning for infection.
Family meeting held to discuss goals of care.

Medications: Enoxaparin 40 mg daily for DVT prophylaxis
ElectronicMedicalRecords.HospitalDischarge: Discharged on 10/05/2024 after a prolonged ICU stay.

Sepsis.ClinicalNotes: Leukocytosis and fevers prompting concern for possible sepsis; cultures negative to date.

BloodProducts.TransfusionEvents: One unit of packed red blood cells administered to maintain hemoglobin above 8.
